c74object.name: fl.biquadcoeff~
c74object.description: The filter mode is set by the mode parameter. Filter settings may be made either via parameters or per sample via inputs. The type of input and output is determined by the coefficients parameter. If set to dynamic then inputs are created for per sample values. Output will be at least one sample or as long as the longest input frame. Frames of per sample values are padded to length with their final value if required. Additional values are ignored. In this mode the parameter value is used if no corresponding input is provided. Thus, per sample values and parameters can be mixed. If coefficients is set to tagged then a single frame of tagged output is output. In tagged mode and static mode filter settings are made via parameters only. In static mode each output is a single value.

entry.name: /gain [double]
entry.description: Sets the linear gain of the filter.

entry.name: /qs [double]
entry.description: Sets the q or s of the filter.

entry.name: /mode [enum]
entry.description:
[0] - lowpass [1] - bandpass [2] - highpass [3] - peaknotch [4] - resonant [5] - notch [6] - lowshelf [7] - highshelf
Sets the filter mode:
lowpass - low pass.
bandpass - band pass.
highpass - high pass.
peaknotch - peak notch.
resonant - resonant.
notch - band reject.
lowshelf - low shelf.
highshelf - high shelf.

entry.name: /coefficients [instantiation enum]
entry.description:
[0] - static [1] - dynamic [2] - tagged
Sets the coefficients input and output modes.
static - settings are made via parameters with single value outputs.
dynamic - settings are made via inputs or parameters with output as vectors.
tagged - settings are made via parameters with output as a tagged frame.

objarg.name: freq
objarg.description:
This argument sets the freq parameter:
Sets the filter frequency.

objarg.name: gain
objarg.digest: Sets the linear gain of the filter
objarg.description:
This argument sets the gain parameter:
Sets the linear gain of the filter.

objarg.name: qs
objarg.digest: Sets the q or s of the filter
objarg.description:
This argument sets the qs parameter:
Sets the q or s of the filter.

objarg.name: mode
objarg.description:
This argument sets the mode parameter:
Sets the filter mode:
lowpass - low pass.
bandpass - band pass.
highpass - high pass.
peaknotch - peak notch.
resonant - resonant.
notch - band reject.
lowshelf - low shelf.
highshelf - high shelf.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.biquadcoeff~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.biquadcoeff~. When set to 0 fl.biquadcoeff~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.biquadcoeff~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
